properties.bij_summary_short: In the first known US targeted assassination using a drone, a CIA Predator struck a car killing six al Qaeda suspects.
First known drone strike in Pakistan kills at least six, including infamous Taliban leader Nek Mohammad and two children. Wana, South Waziristan.
Two killed, including Haitham al-Yemeni an al Qaeda explosives expert, near Mir Ali, North Waziristan.
Failed strike against Abu Hamza Rabia ("al Qaeda’s Number 3") kills eight including three children.
Syrian Abu Hamza Rabia, the senior al Qaeda operative targeted in B3, was killed with two other foreign militants and two boys, aged eight and 17.
An attack on an unnamed alleged al Qaeda official left eight killed, including two women and at least one child.
A strike targeted a possible militant commanders' meeting. But main target Ayman al Zawahiri was absent. Up to 22 people died, most or all civilians, including at least five children.
properties.target: Ayman al-Zawahiri; Abu Khabab al-Masri; Abd Rahman al-Masri al-Maghribi; Abu Ubeidah al-Masri; Marwan al-Suri; Khalid Habib; Abdul Hadi al-Iraqi

properties.bij_summary_short: An attack on a madrassa (allegedly a "Taliban training camp") killed 81-83, including at least 69 children.
Initial claims of 30 Taliban killed were lowered to eight deaths, who villagers insist were all innocent woodcutters.
Attack on a house and madrassa killed 3-4, reportedly all named civilians.
20-34 killed in attack on a madrassa, including ‘foreigners’. All killed could have been civilians and one report said children were among the dead.
CIA drone strike kills 5-10 alleged Haqqani Network militants.
Strike injures Egyptian al Qaeda leader and ideologue Shaykh Issa al-Masri, Details later emerge via leaked US intelligence document.
Abu Laith al-Libi, a senior al Qaeda figure, was killed along with 12-15 others.
At least 8 killed, including possibly students, in strike on a madrassa.
At least 12 alleged militants in an attack on the home of tribal elder Noorullah Wazir.
Failed attack on Abu Sulayman al Jazairi, an al Qaeda weapons expert, kills at least 12 in a rare strike outside Waziristan.
One killed in strike on Makeen, South Waziristan.
A strike on a seminary killed al Qaeda’s "chemical weapons team", one woman and up to three boys.
At least 13 killed, including two named Taliban. Women and children reported among casualties. Bhagar, South Waziristan.
8-12 people killed in attack on alleged militant house.
Attack on al Qaeda-associated meeting killed none but injured four.
Five killed including two Arab-Canadians. Korzai, South Waziristan.
Woman and child killed along with four suspected militants, including two ‘commanders’. Ghundi, North Waziristan.
Attack in unknown location kills 4-10 alleged al Qaeda militants.
Named al Qaeda militant killed along with 4-6 others. Momadkhel, North Waziristan.
Three women and four children killed in attack on two houses in Miranshah, North Waziristan. Five ‘militants’ also reported killed by some sources.
At least 11 civilians, mostly girls, killed with six others including four named militants.
10-15 alleged militants killed in Tol Khel, North Waziristan.
4-7 killed including possibly Abu Ubaydh Al Tunisi, identified as a High Value Target in a leaked US intelligence document.
4-8 killed, 9 injured in attack on Toorikhel, North Waziristan.
Two women and a child killed in a strike on two houses in Datta Khel, North Waziristan.
21 killed including a woman and a child. Datta Khel, North Waziristan.
4-9 people killed, including women and children.
The house of Rahmat Jahan is attacked killing five and wounding two. Miranshah, North Waziristan.
Named al Qaeda leader killed along with 4 militants and 4 civilians. Tapargai, South Waziristan.
7-11 killed, possibly including children, in attack on Danda Darpakhel, North Waziristan.
Failed strike on Haji Omar kills 15-20, including at least four civilians.
Between 4 and 25 killed, possibly including civilians, in failed attack on al Qaeda targets. Mir Ali, North Waziristan.
properties.target: Abu Jihad al-Masri; Abdur Rehman abu Akash

properties.bij_summary_short: Up to 12 killed and Taliban leader Maulvi Nazir among 30 wounded.
Up to 16 killed, including ‘Westerners and US citizens’. Kumsham, Miramshah, North Waziristan.
11-13 killed including at least three civilians. Garyom, North Waziristan.
Al Qaeda operative Abdullah Azzam al Saudi killed with up to five others in attack outside FATA which causes uproar.
Two named militants and up to four others killed in Ali Khel, Miranshah, North Waziristan.
Drone strike destroys vehicle killing five alleged Pakistan Taliban.
Two or three killed, possibly all civilians. Chashma, Miranshah, North Waziristan.
3-4 alleged Taliban killed in Kateera, Mir Ali, North Waziristan.
Six or seven killed, either some ‘foreigners’ or all civilians, Azam Warzak, South Waziristan.
At least two killed in Tapi Tool, Miran Shah, North Waziristan.
Three killed in attack on a truck in Kari Kot, Wana, South Waziristan.
At least two killed in attack on truck in Shin Warzak, Wana, South Waziristan.
Two named al Qaeda militants and up to thee other people killed in strike on vehicle, Kari Kot, Wana, South Waziristan.
Three to four killed in last strike of Bush presidency.  Madin, South Waziristan.
7 civilians and 4 or more militants reported killed in strike on house in Zharki, Mir Ali,North Waziristan.
7-11 people killed, including several members of a family killed including at least three children in strike on wrong house in Dilfar, Wana, South Waziristan.
26-35 alleged militants and 8-year old boy killed in strike on house and madrassa in Zangari, South Waziristan.
30-31 killed in a strike on a camp in Sarpal, Kurram Agency
At least seven killed in an attack on alleged TTP facility in Sararogha, Wana, South Waziristan.
14-25 killed and 30-50 injured in attack on TTP camp in Barjo, Kurram Agency.
2-5 alleged militants killed in Sain Tanga, Janni Khel, Bannu.
7-8 alleged militants killed in attack on cars and house in Maken, South Waziristan.
4-5 militants or civilians killed in strike on house in Sokhel, Mir Ali, North Waziristan.
Women and children among 12-14 killed in strike on house in Khadezai, Orakzai Agency.
At least 7 civilians, and possibly all, of 13 killed in strike on house. Datta Khel, Miramshah, North Waziristan.
Four alleged militants killed and up to five civilians injured in strike on car and shops, Gangi Khel, Wana, South Waziristan.
Up to eight civilians including as many as two children killed in Gangi Khel, Wana, South Waziristan.
Named al Qaeda leader and 5-9 others, possibly including civilians, killed in Kaniguram, Wana, South Waziristan.
9-25 killed, possibly four civilians, in strike in Tabbi Langhar Khel, South Waziristan.
At least eight alleged militants killed in attack on compound in Sara Khwara, South Waziristan.
At least 25 people, including nine civilians, killed in a strike on house and rescuers in Kaisore, Miranshah, North Waziristan.
3-5 alleged militants killed in strike on truck in Ladha South Waziristan.
12-14 killed, including 10 civilian rescuers, in double strike in Shah Alam, Wana, South Waziristan.
Strike with unknown casualty figures in Raghzai area, near Wana, South Waziristan.
Named TTP commander among six killed in a strike on Makeen, South Waziristan
67-83 killed (including 18-45 civilians) in a strike on a funeral in Makeen, South Waziristan.
An attack on a closed madrassa ‘occasionally used by the TTP’ killed either three, five or no people. Mantoi, South Waziristan.
13-17 alleged militants killed and 27-35 injured in strike on compound in Kokat Khel, South Waziristan.
16-18 alleged militants killed in strike on compound in Jangara, Makeen, South Waziristan.
8-10 alleged TTP militants killed in strike on camp in Laddha, Karwan Manza South Waziristan.
35-40 alleged militants killed when convoy destroyed in  Laddha, Karwan Manza, South Waziristan.
3-5 alleged militants killed in strike on ‘communications centre’ in Painda, South Waziristan.
Two media sources reported a possible drone strike that killed five – this may be part of Ob28.
5-6 alleged TTP militants killed in strike on house in Gariwam, North Waziristan.
Named TTP leader dies with at least one other, in strike on Zanghara, South Waziristan.
14-25 killed in strike on ‘Taliban suicide bomber training camp’ in  Saam, near Ladha, South Waziristan.
At least 9 civilians including 6 children among 17-21 killed in strike on houses and madrassa in Danda Darpakhel, North Waziristan.
Named militant leader killed with at least seven others in strike on house in Tapar Ghai, Kanigram, South Waziristan.
Three civilians among 5-8 killed in a failed strike on senior al Qaeda leader Ilyas Kashmiri.
10-15 killed including three civilians in strike on house in Dargmandi, Miranshah, North Waziristan.
Five killed including including Islamic Jihad Union leader Najmiddin Kamolitdinovic Jalolov in a strike on a vehicle.
Strike kills 10-12, possibly including civilians, in Mir Ali, North Waziristan.
5-6 alleged militants killed in strike on house in Sararogha, South Waziristan.
At least four alleged Haqqani militants killed in strike on house in Danda Darpakhel, North Waziristan.
8-9 alleged militants killed in strike on cars and house in Norak, Miransha, North Waziristan.
3-4 alleged militants killed in strike on house in Danda Darpakhel, North Waziristan.
Al Qaeda explosives expert Abu Musa al-Masri and 2 others killed in strike in Spalaga, North Waziristan.
20-27 alleged militants killed in strike on compound in Damadola, Bajaur Agency.
4-6 alleged militants killed in strike on house in Norak, Mir Ali, North Waziristan.
3-6 alleged militants killed in strike on house in Shanakhora, Miranshah, North Waziristan.
Three civilians, including one child, killed in a strike on a ‘training compound’ in Machi Khel, North Waziristan.
Al Qaeda planner Said al-Somali among four killed in strike on car in Miran Shah, North Waziristan.
Six alleged militants killed in strike on ‘hide-out’ in Laddha, South Waziristan.
2 alleged militants killed in car in Gadda Maramay, Datta Khel, North Waziristan.
2 named al Qaeda commanders among 13-15 alleged militants killed in Amboor Shagal, North Waziristan.
5-8 killed at funeral prayers for victims of Ob49, Wazgai, Datta Khel, North Waziristan.
14 Taliban killed and 12 injured in strike on house in Saigdai, North Waziristan.
Three civilians, including one child, among up to seven killed in a strike on a Taliban commander.
3 alleged militants killed when car destroyed in Ghundikala, North Waziristan.
Five killed including 1-2 civilians, in attack on house and car in Mosaki, North Waziristan.
5-7 killed, possibly including civilians, in strike on house in Datta Khel, North Waziristan.
Up to nine rescuers killed in attack on house in Datta Khel, North Waziristan.
Three year old girl killed along with five suspected militants in attack on houses, Tappi, North Waziristan.
Two named militants killed with at least two others in attack on house in Ismail Khel, North Waziristan.
Failed attack on TTP leader Hakimullah Mehsud kills 15-18 in Shaktoi, North Waziristan.
Five alleged militants killed in attack on house in Zanani, North Waziristan.
TTP commander Azmatullah Mawiya among five killed in Shaktoi, North Waziristan.
Four named TTP commanders among at least 20 killed in attack on house in Shaktoi, North Waziristan.
At least five alleged militants killed in strike on house and car in Deegan, North Waziristan.
9-15 alleged militants killed in strike on compound in Muhammad Khel, North Waziristan.
A drone swarm attacks compound killing 23 alleged militants across three strikes.
A strike reportedly targets locals firing on a nearby swarm of drones. Casualties unknown.
Five civilians reportedly among nine killed as they drive to sites of previous attacks. Pai Khel, North Waziristan.
Attack on village, casualties unknown. Toor Narai, North Waziristan.
Three alleged militants killed in strike on house and car in Mir Ali, North Waziristan.
Abdul Haq al-Turkistani, leader of militant group the Turkistani Islamic Party among up to five killed in attack on car in Tappi, North Waziristan.
Al Qaeda operative Shaikh Mansoor among four killed in strike on guesthouse.
Three named militants among up to 4-5 killed in vehicle in Danda Darpakhel, North Waziristan.
5-6 civilians, including a small child, among up to 13 killed in attack on house and car in Dargi Mandi. North Waziristan.
Nine al Qaeda, including Hussein al-Yemeni, killed in strike on hotel in Miranshah, North Waziristan.
Eight killed in strike on house and car in Madakhel, North Waziristan.
Seven rescuers, at least four of them civilians, killed as they try to retrieve dead and injured, Datta Khel, North Waziristan.
At least 10 killed including eight al Qaeda in Datta Khel, North Waziristan.
Five alleged militants killed after two cars attacked in Hamzoni, North Waziristan.
Five alleged militants killed in strike on car in Mada Khel, North Waziristan.
5-8 alleged militants killed in Lowari Mandi, North Waziristan.
Six alleged militants killed in strike on car and house in Machis, North Waziristan.
Four people, possibly all civilians, killed in attack on houses in Hurmaz, North Waziristan.
Five members of a family among up to six civilians killed in strike on ex-school in Tappi, North Waziristan.
At least eight civilians among 13 reported killed in Boya, North Waziristan.
Four killed in car in Angar Shaga, North Waziristan.
At least three alleged militants and rescuers killed in attack in Toor Khel, North Waziristan.
7-9 alleged militants killed in Machi Khel, North Waziristan.
6-8 killed in attack on Taliban commander’s home in Khushali Toorkhel, North Waziristan.
German militant Eric Breininger, alias Abdul Gaffar el-Almani, among 4-6 dead, two possibly civilians in Mir Ali, North Waziristan.
10 killed including four reported civilians in attack on house in Datta Khel, North Waziristan.
Villagers among 13-14 dead in attack on car and house in Doga, Datta Khel, North Waziristan.
7-15 alleged militants killed in attack on Gorwek, North Waziristan.
5-15 killed including up to two civilians in first known attack on Khyber Agency.
Al Qaeda’s chief finance officer Mustafa Abu Yazid killed with at least nine others, six of them civilians, in Mohammad Khel, North Waziristan.
8-12 killed including two named militants and possibly some civilians in Mizai Nara, South Waziristan.
Two named militants among seven killed in Khaddi or Norak, North Waziristan.
13-15 killed including ‘foreigners’ in Datta Khel, North Waziristan.
Named al Qaeda commander among 16-17 alleged militants killed in Soheel, Mir Ali, North Waziristan.
2-4 killed in attack on house in Khushali Khel, North Waziristan.
Six killed, including possible named Taliban commander, in Tappi Torkhel, North Waziristan.
Named militant among 7-10 killed in attack on Karikot, South Waziristan.
10-14 killed, including up to 7 civilians, in attack on house in Sheerani, North Waziristan
16-18 alleged militants killed in attack on compound in Dwasarak, South Waziristan.
14 alleged militants killed in Shaktoi, South Waziristan.
Attack kills 4-7 alleged Haqqani militants in Tabbi, North Waziristan.
Four alleged TTP militants killed in Landikhel, South Waziristan.
Named Taliban commander killed with 13 others in strike on Issori, North Waziristan.
4-6 killed, possibly including civilians, in attack on car in Kutabkhel, North Waziristan.
20 killed including 10 civilians in strike that supposedly led to change in CIA tactics. Darga Mandi, North Waziristan.
5-7 killed in attack on compound in Derga Mandai, North Waziristan.
Nine alleged militants killed in attack on trucks in Kurram Agency.
A strike destroyed a residential compound. No casualty figures are available. Badshah Kot, Kurram Agency
Three alleged miltants killed in attack on house in Taaloo Ganj, Kurram Agency.
6-9 alleged militants killed in attack on house in Miranshah, North Waziristan.
2-4 killed in strike in Datta Khel, North Waziristan.
Eight alleged militants killed in attack on vehicle in Datta Khel, North Waziristan.
Six alleged militants were killed in an attack on a car. Khar Qamar area of North Waziristan.
Four children and 6 alleged militants killed in attack on houses in Danda Darpakhel, North Waziristan.
Four alleged militants killed in strike on car in Ambar Shaga, North Waziristan.
Two named militants, including a Briton and Uzbek, killed with at least eight others in strike on compound in Danda Darpakhel, North Waziristan.
Six alleged militants killed in attack on house in Miranshah, North Waziristan.
5-7 alleged militants killed in attack on house in Newey Adda, North Waziristan.
11-12 alleged Haqqani militants killed in strike on house in Bushnarai, North Waziristan.
Saifullah Haqqani among four dead when car destroyed in Qutabkhel, North Waziristan.
Up to 15 killed including civilian rescuers in attack on alleged militant compound in Dargha Mandi, North Waziristan.
5-7 alleged militants killed in strike on housing compound in Payakhel, North Waziristan.
4 alleged Haqqani militants killed and possibly 5 civilians in strike in Deghan, Datta Khel, North Waziristan.
Six killed including up to three civilians in a a strike on a motorbike and rescuers.
7-8 alleged militants killed in attack on car in Khand Morsak, South Waziristan.
Failed attack on militant leader (possibly at funeral) kills 16 in Azam Warsak, South Waziristan.
Two sources claim that up to eight people were killed in a third strike of the day. No further details are known, and the Bureau presently treats this only as a possible strike.
3 named al Qaeda including a commander among 4 dead in Miranshah, North Waziristan.
4 alleged militants killed in attack on truck in Lawra Mandi, Datta Khel.
3-5 killed, possibly civilians, in attack on jeep in Miranshah, North Waziristan.
2-3 people killed in attack on vehicle in Sherani, North Waziristan.
3-4 alleged militants killed in strike on house in Khushali Toorikhel, North Waziristan.
4 alleged militants killed in attack on house in Zeba, South Waziristan.
At least nine alleged militants killed including (possibly) named TTP commander. Asar, Datta Khel, North Waziristan.
8-14 people, possibly militants, killed in attack in Inzarkas, North Waziristan.
5-9 killed, including a named German-Turk, a named German-Iranian and a named Briton.
Failed attack on named al Qaeda commander kills 5-6 in Miranshah, North Waziristan.
3-5 alleged militants killed in attack on house in Hurmuz, Mir Ali, North Waziristan.
4 alleged militants killed including 1 named al Qaeda operative in Khaisoori, North Waziristan.
4-6 killed in Mohammad Khel, North Waziristan.
5-8 people killed, some possibly civilians, in attack on house in Charkhel, North Waziristan.
Double strike in vicinity of refugee camp kills 7-9 people. Shiva, Mir Ali, North Waziristan.
Attack on house and car kills at least 11 including rescuers in Datta Khel, North Waziristan.
4-6 alleged militants killed in attack on house in Aziz Khel, North Waziristan.
3-5 militants - all possibly civilians - killed in strike on vehicle in Machi Khel, North Waziristan.
10 year old boy killed with 6 alleged militants in Danda Darpakhel.
4-5 alleged militants killed in attack on house in Spinwam, North Waziristan.
4 alleged militants including westerners killed in Degan, Datta Khel, North Waziristan.
5-8 alleged militants killed as a body from Ob151 was being moved for a funeral, Ismail Khan, North Waziristan.
6 alleged militants killed in attack on house in Haider Khel, North Waziristan.
4-5 alleged militants killed in strike on car in Qutab Khel, North Waziristan.
4-5 alleged militants killed in strike on car in Khaso Khel, North Waziristan.
4-5 alleged militants killed in attack on car in Datta Khel, North Waziristan.
9 alleged militants killed in strike on house and car in Ghulam Khan, North Waziristan.
4-6 people killed in strike on car in Datta Khel, North Waziristan.
5-8 alleged Taliban killed in strike on house in Ghulam Khan, North Waziristan.
4 civilians or alleged militants killed in car in Miranshah, North Waziristan.
20 reported killed, including possibly women and children, in strike in Ghulam Khan, North Waziristan.
3-4 alleged militants killed in strike on car in Naurak, North Waziristan.
6-9 killed including local named militant leader and possibly 3 civilians in Khaddi, North Waziristan.
5-6 alleged militants killed in strike on car and motorbike in Kaisore, North Waziristan.
3-4 civilians killed in strike on car in Pir Keley, North Waziristan.
0-4 alleged militants killed in successful (or failed) strike on car in Hassan Khel, North Waziristan.
2 alleged militants killed as car destroyed in Khushali, North Waziristan. When survivor flees into nearby shop, drone reportedly destroys store, killing him and 2 shopkeepers.
Two people killed in a previously unreported strike revealed by a US official in August 2011.
Two Britons among four alleged militants killed in Khadar Khel, North Waziristan.
3-4 alleged militants or villagers killed in Spalga, North Waziristan.
Named Taliban commander among 7 aleged militants killed in strike in Tirah valley, Khyber Agency.
Strike on cars kills 7 in Sandana, Khyber Agency.
11-15 alleged Swat TTP killed in strike on compound, Naqai/ Narai, Khyber Agency.
4 named commanders among 30 alleged militants killed. Two civilians also died, in  Speen Drang, Khyber Agency.
5 local named commanders among 18-22 alleged militants killed near Mir Ali, North Waziristan.
4 people killed, status unknown, in strike on vehicle in Machi Khel, North Waziristan.
5-6 alleged militants killed in Ghulam Khan, North Waziristan.
5-12 rescuers, including 2-4 civilians, killed when drones strike again.  Ghulam Khan, North Waziristan.
9-10 killed in strikes on trucks carrying alleged militants, and wounded from previous strikes.  Nawab, Ghulam Khan, North Waziristan.
4-8 alleged Taliban pursued and killed by drone after Afghan raid.  Ghulam Khan, North Waziristan.
8-9 killed in strike on car and house, Mandi Khel, North Waziristan.
After waiting two hours with drones still overhead, rescuers attempted to retrieve the dead and injured from Ob180 but were attacked. Up to six people were killed. Mandi Khel, North Waziristan
4-5 alleged militants killed in attack on car in Datta Khel, North Waziristan.
4 alleged militants killed in strike on vehicle in Boya or Mohammad Khel, North Waziristan.
4-6 alleged militants or civilians killed in strike on motorbike and house. Ghar Laley, North Waziristan.
3-5 alleged militants killed in attack on house in Haider Khel, North Waziristan.
3-7 alleged militants killed in strike on house in Datta Khel, North Waziristan.
4-5 alleged militants killed in car in Doga Mada Khel, North Waziristan.
2-3 alleged militants killed in attack on motorbike in Doga Mada Khel, North Waziristan.
4-6 alleged militants killed when vehicle and house struck in Razmak, North Waziristan.
3 Turkmenistan nationals and 2 ‘Arabs’ reported among 6-7 dead in attack on house. Al Qaeda finance officer Abu Zaid al-Iraqi later reported killed.
7-11 people - possibly all civilians - killed in attack on house and car in Malik Ashdar, North Waziristan.
5-7 alleged militants killed in attack on car and house in Mohammad Khel, North Waziristan.
5 killed – either militants or civilians – in attack on house in Landidog, South Waziristan.
5 alleged militants killed in attack on house in Datta Khel. North Waziristan.
A double strike on a vehicle (and possibly a house) killed at least six people including rescuers.
A double strike on a vehicle (and possibly a house) killed at least six people including rescuers.
Four unknown persons killed in strike on car in Ghoroski, North Waziristan.
0-4 killed and 0-5 injured in an attack which destroyed a car but may have missed the occupants.  Azam Warsak, South Waziristan.
6-7 alleged militants killed in strike on house and car in Spalga, North Waziristan.
3-6 alleged militants killed in a moving car in Malik Jashdar, North Waziristan.
Attack on either house or car kills 4-5 in Datta Khel, North Waziristan.
Attack on tribal meeting kills 26-42 people, 31-42 of them civilians, at a jirga or tribal gathering in North Waziristan.
6-7 alleged militants killed in strike on vehicles and building in Angor Adda, South Waziristan.
Up to 25 killed, including 1-8 civilians, in strike on house in Spinwan, North Waziristan.

A fresh attempt was made to kill US-born cleric Anwar al-Awlaki in a co-ordinated drone strike. Instead two AQAP-linked brothers died, identified by Yemeni government officials as Abdullah Mubarak and Mosaad Mubarak (or al-Harad).
15-18 killed, including six civilians, when restaurant hit along with targeted religious school in Dwa Tooe, Datta Khel, North Waziristan.
3-5 alleged militants killed in strike on vehicle in Angor Ada/ Baghar, South Waziristan.
7-8 alleged militants killed in strike on van and possibly house in Datta Khel, North Waziristan.
3-5 alleged militants killed in strike on car in Doga Mada Khel, North Waziristan.
Attack on compound kills 4-10 alleged militants in Sandasa, Mir Ali, North Waziristan.
3-6 alleged militants killed in strike on pick-up truck in Mir Ali, North Waziristan.
4-6 alleged militants killed in attack on moving vehicle in Tappi, North Waziristan.
4-7 alleged militants killed in strike on van in Mir Ali, North Waziristan.
US airstrike in the city of Zinjibar, most likely a drone, killed Abu Ali al-Harithi and a number of other militants as well as four civilians.
Up to 5 named al Qaeda killed among 8-12 alleged militants in strike on orchard in Ghwa Khwa, South Waziristan.
House destroyed killing 7-9 alleged militants in Shalam Ragzhai, South Waziristan.
8-10 killed, including possibly 7 civilians, in attack on seminary in Wacha Dana, South Waziristan.
3-5 alleged militants killed in attack on car in Darnashtra, South Waziristan.
18-23 alleged militants killed in attack on compound in Zoynari, South Waziristan.
4 militants or civilians killed in strike on truck in Shawal, South Waziristan.
At least one top insurgent was killed in the US military-led strikes by unmanned aircraft.
A security official from Abyan province claimed that one of three linked strikes against militants resulted in the deaths of three civilians.
Attack on house kills 3-10 alleged militants in Wana, South Waziristan.
None killed as car occupants escape drone strike in Karez, South Waziristan.
5-6 civilians killed in strike on car near Miranshah, North Waziristan.
Six civilians were wounded in an apparent drone strike targeting ‘senior jihadists’. However, no AQAP militants were reported to be hit in the attack.
7 alleged militants and rescuers killed in strike on car in Khardand, Kurram Agency.
3-5 alleged militants killed in strike on house in Zarakai, Kurram Agency.

In the first known lethal drone strike in Somalia, Predators struck a militant training camp 10km south of Kismayo. Further missiles hit a second target near the airport. At least 2 people were killed.
6-12 killed in strike on truck and compound in Shawal, North Waziristan.
14-21 alleged militants killed in attack on ‘training camp’ in Shakai, South Waziristan.
Named Western al Qaeda militant among 4-6 reported killed in strike on guesthouse in Mir Ali, North Waziristan.
5-12 killed, including possibly 5 civilians, in strike on van in Borvaika/ Gorwak in North Waziristan.
12-25 alleged militants killed in strike on compound in Gorvak/ Shawal, North Waziristan.

An attack on a house and/ or car killed 5-13 alleged militants, including ‘foreigners’. Three students ‘with militant links’ were killed in either this or Ob230, named as Hafiz Bilal, Waheed Ullah and Fayaz. Barmal, South Wazir
13-15 alleged militants killed in strike on car and house in Dre Nishatr, Shawal valley, North Waziristan.
8-9 people were killed in strike on car. At least one civilian casualty. Datta Khel, North Waziristan.
At least six people were reported killed in a US strike in Abyan province. The New York Times claimed the same strike killed eight, whilst CNN claimed that as many as 50 people were killed.
A US strike on a car targeted Fahd al-Qusaa, also known as Quso, an al Qaeda leader and suspect in the USS Cole bombing. He reportedly left the car minutes earlier and was unharmed.
4 alleged militants killed in Khushali Toori Khel, Mir Ali, North Waziristan.
Five AQAP militants, including a field commander, were killed by a US drone strike on Karadeef, in western Zinjibar.
Two or three airstrikes killed up to 16 alleged militants, including local al Qaeda leader Nader Shadadi.
4-6 people - possibly all civilians - killed in strike on car in Azam Warsak, South Waziristan.
3-4 alleged militants killed in strike on car. Qutab Khel, North Waziristan.
20-25 killed and vehicle destroyed in pre-dawn strike. Miranshah, North Waziristan
4-7 killed, including possibly 3-4 civilians, and 2 injured in a strike on a housing compound and vehicle. Miranshah, North Waziristan.
3-4 killed and 2 injured in strike on house. Shin Warsak, South Waziristan.
4-7 killed, including possibly 0-4 civilians, and 3 injured in strike on vehicle. Norak, North Waziristan.

The News was the single source for reports of a second strike on a house on August 22 that killed a family of Arabs, ‘three men, two children and a lady. Local villagers said an Arab family was residing in the house and all those died in the missile attack were Arab nationals.’ The newspaper speculated that this strike killed Atiyah abd al-Rahman (see Ob239).
6 killed in Abyan. Source unable to confirm whether air strike was Yemeni Air Force or US drone

Urdu TV station Ajj reports that an evening strike killed up to seven alleged militants in an unspecified location in North Waziristan, a day after the end of the four-day Eid holiday. No further details are known from this single source.

10 al-Qaida militants were killed and dozens of others were injured' when a US drone struck 'several targets' in Abyan, Xinhua said. Predator drones also 'bombed an abandoned hotel and a primary school on the eastern outskirts of Jaar city' in Abyan.
4-5 killed and 2 injured in strike on 10th anniversary of 9-11. Hisokhel, North Waziristan.
There were two alleged US drone strikes reported on this day, killing 4 and up to 7, respectively.
A second strike reportedly targeted militants in the southern port city of Shaqra, killing up to seven people.
3-8 alleged militants killed and 3-4 injured in strike on house and vehicle. Khushali, North Waziristan.
The United States launched a series of drone attacks on al-Shabaab in Kismayo, according to residents, who reported attacks on three locations.
Up to four killed and up to two injured in strike on a compound. Azam Warsak, South Waziristan.
3-4 killed and 5 injured in strike on a vehicle. Baghar, South Waziristan.
Anwar al-Awlaki, the US-born cleric, became the first US citizen to be deliberately killed by the CIA in a drone strike. 3 others were killed as well.

Four Somali farmers were reported to have been killed in a possible drone strike in Dolbiyow Village, 35km east of Dhobley. The farmers and their camels were killed moments after al-Shabaab fighters fled the area in vehicles, witnesses said.
4-6 killed and 4 injured. Danda Darpakhel, North Waziristan.
3-6 killed in strike on a compound. Zeba Pahar, South Waziristan.
In the first of several attacks on this day, a drone attack struck a house in the Azan district of Shabwah, but the occupants of the house had left two minutes earlier.
5-6 alleged militants killed in strike on a vehicle. Danda Darpakhel, North Waziristan.
Drone strike killed 7-9 people, including a 16 and 17-year-old boy. Abdulrahman al-Awlaki, the 16-year old son of Anwar al-Awlaki, was one of the people who perished.
A third possible drone attack killed up to 17 people on Friday night.

Saleh Qaid Toayman and his 14-year-old son were reported killed in an overnight strike in Azan. They were grazing camels 'in an area known to be controlled by al-Qaida,' and had then slept by a mosque, according to Toayman's 15-year-old son Azzedine who survived the strike.
3-6 killed and 3-7 injured in strike on a compound. Angor Adda, South Waziristan.

There were reports of a further strike in South Waziristan on Maulvi Nazir's forces, which killed up to seven alleged militants. Three of those killed were named as Hazrat Ali, Sher Ali and Amir Hamza – possibly 'low level Taliban commanders.'
At least 11 civilians died and more than 20 others were wounded after a possible US drone attacked on Afmadow town in the Lower Jubba region.
13-22 killed and 6 injured in a strike.
4-6 killed and 3-4 injured in a strike on a vehicle. Azam Warsak, South Waziristan.
A second strike of the day on either a moving vehicle or a house in North Waziristan killed 4-6 alleged militants, according to Pakistani security officials. No further details were given.
Strike on a vehicle killed 4-6.
An attack on a vehicle near the town of Mir Ali, North Waziristan killed 2-4 people, including at two civilians.

An attack on an alleged militant housing compound near Miranshah in North Waziristan killed up to three people and injured three others, according to local officials. Dawn reported that the casualties were part of the Haqqani Network.
The militant stronghold of Rumeila was targeted by 'five US drone strikes,' killing an unknown number of people.
Missiles were fired at a training camp in Afgoye, Lower Shabelle, according to al Shabaab. 1-2 reported killed. Unclear who was responsible for the strikes.
7 killed and 2-4 injured in strike on a house in Miranshah.
16-22 killed in strike on two housing compounds in Babar Ghar.
In the third strike in as many days, CIA drones attacked a compound in North Waziristan, killing 7-9.
A US drone strike reportedly killed Abdulrahman al-Wuhayshi, the younger brother of Nasser al-Wuhayshi, a Yemeni who leads AQAP.
1-4 people killed in a strike on a house near Miranshah. Aslam Awan (aka Abdullah Khorasani), a senior operations operative for al Qaeda  is believed to be among dead.
5-9 alleged militants killed and 2-3 injured in a strike on two vehicles near Dogga.
Three missiles fired from a suspected drone operated by JSOC killed British-Lebanese militant Bilal Al-Barjawi, also known as Abu Hafsa.
4-5 alleged militants killed and 1 injured in a strike on a vehicle near Deegan.
10-14 people killed in Abyan.
9-10 alleged militants killed and up to 12 injured a strike on a house near Miranshah.
5-8 killed, possibly 2 civilians, in a strike on a house near Miransha.  Badar Mansoor, a local Pakistani al Qaeda leader, and his wife and child are believed to be amongst dead.
6 alleged militants killed and up to 7 injured in a strike on a house near Spalga.
10-15 alleged militants killed in a strike on a vehicle in Mir Ali.

Hours after Secretary Clinton told the London Somalia conference that airstrikes against al Shabaab 'would not be a good idea', a US drone strike killed up to seven alleged Islamists in Lower Shabelle.

8-15 alleged militants killed and 3 injured in a strike on a vehicle in the Mandao borderlands area. Amongst dead was German citizen Samir H, believed to be one of the most dangerous Islamists in the country.
Two sources reported a second strike. The first reportedly hit a vehicle, killing up to 15 militants. The second strike was said to have hit a house 12 kilometres away, killing ‘six Uzbeks.’

A late evening airstrike on Bayda by US drones struck a gathering of alleged militants. As many as 34 ‘AQAP militants' died. Two brothers of local businessman Salim al-Barakani – one a teacher, the other a cellphone repairman, were among the civilians killed.

Air strikes in Jaar and Zinjibar killed up to 24 alleged militants. Although initially reported as the work of the Yemen Air Force, a senior Yemen government official told CNN that the attacks were the work of the US, part of a three-day offensive.

An air attack on a militant-occupied factory where arms were allegedly stored killed three near Jaar. Ansar al Sharia said US drones carried out the early evening strike, with up to five drones reportedly taking part.
4-5 people were killed in a strike on a moving vehicle. CNN reported that the strike appeared to be the work of the US.
6-8 alleged militants belived to be senoir commanders of a Taliban faction were killed and 2-4 injured in a strike on a vehicle.
7 unknown alleged militants killed and 3 injured in a strike on a vehicle in the borderlands of North and South Waziristan.
According to local Yemen officials, three areas in Zinjibar were struck by US drone strikes, killing at least 30 al Qaeda fighters.
A Miranshah house destroyed killing 4 alleged militants.

Four alleged AQAP militants died and three were 'critically injured' after a US drone struck their vehicles. 6-9 others were injured, including 5 civilians. One of the civilians, Mohamed, would later die.
Multiple airstrikes killed as many as 38 ‘suspected al Qaeda militants’ in Lahj and Abyan over a 48-hour period, according to CNN. A number of officials confirmed US involvement
News agencies reported a night time US drone strike on a moving vehicle in Shabwah province. The Yemen Air Force lacks the technical ability to carry out such a strike.

The Yemen Defence Ministry reported that ‘Yemeni-U.S. joint air raids bombed al-Qaida hideouts in the southern province of Abyan, killing at least 16 militants’, according to Xinhua. Other agencies did not specify US involvement.
The other militants, 8, were killed when a US drone targeted their car in the province,' alsahwa-yemen.net quoted a tribal source as saying.

A targeted evening strike on an ‘al Qaeda convoy’ reportedly killed up to 14 alleged militants near Loder, Abyan Province. A local government official told Xinhua that the attack was the work of a US drone.

An evening airstrike on a vehicle killed at least three Ansar al-Sharia members, among them reportedly Mohammed al-Sabri, a ‘leading militant’. Associated Press cited two Yemen military officials as saying that US drones had carried out the attack in Al Bayda Province, with a security official telling AFP the same. Eyewitness Abdel-Salam al-Ansi told the agency that he heard a strong explosion and had rushed outside: ‘The car had been turned into a ball of fire.’

Up to five drone strikes killed at least five militants in the southeastern Shabwah province. CNN reported militant hideouts, checkpoints, training facilities and weapons warehouses were targeted in the strikes.
As many as 17 alleged militants were killed in a series of of strikes in the south of the country. AFP said it was unclear whether the strike was carried out by the Yemen Air Force or US drones.

At least four militants were killed when a drone strike destroyed two of three cars driving through the desert area of Sanda in central Marib province. Two senior security officials told CNN that US drones conducted the strike.

A possible drone strike hit vehicles in Shabwah province leaving three dead and two injured. Local Mohammed Bindighar told AP he had seen drones circling overhead almost daily for the last five months.

At least three alleged militants were killed in a possible drone strike in the southern city of Mudiyah. Reuters reported the strike targeted the alleged militants in a vehicle. Residents said they saw two drones after hearing an explosion.
3-6 alleged militants killed and up to 3 injured on a strike on an ex-girl's school in Miranshah.

Three alleged militants were killed driving through the northern province of al-Jawf. A tribal source told AFP the car was completely destroyed and all its occupants killed. AP reported Yemeni officials ‘had no details on the source of the attack or the identity of the three.’
Four alleged militants were killed in an airstrike near the town of Loder. The strike hit a vehicle according to a local government official.

A strike hit a vehicle near Zinjibar killing three alleged al Qaeda militants. A Yemeni presidential aide told CNN the Yemen government had approved a series of US drone strikes on militant positions in the south of the country. Since mid-April there had been at least two US drone strikes a day, the aide continued.
Three Yemeni security officials told CNN a US drone attacked a militant training camp outside the southern town of Jaar, killing up to 15.
8-10 killed and one injured in a strike. Disputes on wether the dead were militants or civilians.

Fahd al-Quso, who admitted to being part responsible for the death of 17 US sailors, died in the attack in Shabwa province. Also initially reported killed was al-Quso’s nephew Fahed Salem al-Akdam, described as a ‘senior AQAP leader.’ However the Washington Post later identified the man as 19-year old farm worker Nasser Salim, who was no relation to Quso.
A series of strikes in the small hours killed up to 8 in Abyan province.

AP reported two more alleged militants killed in a second strike on Shaqra, northeast of the provincial capital Zinjibar. The Yemen Observer reported AQAP claims that a drone killed four men in the strike.
A reported US drone strike took place in al-Hosoon, near the city of Marib. A tribal chief told Reuters that ‘a drone fired two rockets at two vehicles, killing five Al-Qaeda members.’
Agencies reported a second strike of the day, also on a convoy of vehicles: ‘One drone fired rockets at a convoy of three pick-up trucks travelling on a desert road in Hareeb area of Shabwa province.
A possible third drone strike of the day killed between 6 and 10 alleged al Qaeda militants at a ‘hideout‘, according to a local Yemeni official.

At least 14 people were killed in an airstrike in a residential area of Jaar. Two or more strikes in quick succession reduced an entire block to rubble. Initial reports from government sources claimed two or three senior al Qaeda militants were killed as well as at least eight civilians. This changed as more details emerged in subsequent reports. Amnesty International identified 14 civilian victims by name – including a pregnant woman. Survivor Samir al Mushari told USA Today 26 civilians died.

Three alleged militants were killed in a possible US drone strike in the eastern province of Hadhramout. Reuters reported a car apparently carrying explosives was destroyed when the overnight strike targeted a convoy.
A second air strike of the day destroyed a vehicle in the southern province of Bayda. Sources told AFP and Associated Press the strike was carried out by a US drone.
4-5 alleged militants killed and several injured in a strike on a house in Datte Khel Kalai.
10-12 killed and 3 injured, mostly civilians, after a strike hit a house and a nearby mosque during morning prayers.
3-4 alleged militants killed and 2 injured on a strike on bakery in Miransha bazaar.

Up to five alleged militants were killed and four wounded in a possible drone strike in the centre of the country. Anwar al Awlaki‘s brothers-in-law Qaed and Nabil al Dahab were targeted but survived.

In the second strike of the day five alleged militants were killed in the eastern province of Hadhramout, including local commander Saleh Abdul Khaleq Ali Jaber. Local media later named others killed as Hussein Rabi, Malik Bakotain and Muhammad al Saqqaf. A fifth badly burnt body was not identified.
5-10 alleged militants killed and 4 injured in a double strike on a house in the village of Khassokhel.
2-5 alleged militants killed in a strike on a vehicle in Datta Khel.
Local officials and residents told agencies that a US drone had killed 11 -12 men they suspected of being Islamic militants, who were meeting at a house (or ‘communications compound’) in al Mahfad.
2-4 killed - two alleged militants and possibly two civilians in a strike in a vehicle in Khawashi Khel.
7-10 killed and 7-10 injured in a strike on a house where a Taliban funeral took place. Possible civilian deaths.
1-18 alleged militants killed in a strike on a militant compound. Abu Yahya al-Libi, al Qaeda's effective number two, is believed to be amongst dead.
US drones hit southeastern Yemen, killing as many as 27 alleged militants. 'Dozens' reportedly wounded.
A US drone struck a house and car in Azzan, killing nine alleged militants in the early morning.
4 alleged militants killed in a strike on a vehicle traveling east from Miranshah.
The Yemen Times reported a US drone strike hit Azzan in Shabwa province, described as AQAP’s ‘last stronghold’ in the province.
3-4 alleged militants killed in a strike on a shop or house in Miranshah bazaar. AFP reports witness saying another instance of a follow-up strike.

A house in Shaqra was hit in a strike that killed six children and one woman. It was ‘not clear whether the Yemeni air force launched the strike, or whether it came from a US military or CIA drone.’ NPR told the Bureau the strike came after Friday prayers. Ali al Armoudi survived the strike and told NPR his four-year-old son and 6-year-old daughter ‘died in his arms on the way to the hospital.’

An airstrike by an unknown party in northern Abyan killed Hussein Saleh, a worker with the International Committee of the Red Cross. According to an ICRC spokesman ‘it was an air strike. We have no additional details whatsoever.’ An ICRC spokeswoman told the Bureau by email that Saleh ‘was out side an ICRC vehicle when shrapnel hit him. He died from the shrapnel injuries. The strike did not hit the ICRC vehicle directly.’ Three other ICRC staff with Saleh were unhurt in the strike the spokeswoman added. Another ICRC member told the BBC that it was not clear whether the attack was the work of a US drone or the Yemen Air Force.

A US drone has killed three alleged AQAP members, including one senior commander. The identities of those killed were not reported but a security official said a drone fired two missiles on a convoy which destroyed their pick-up truck. Military officials said the vehicles had been pursued by US drones, causing fear among local residents.
At least 4 alleged militants killed when a CIA drone struck a house in the late evening. The strike was reportedly targeting alleged militants linked to Hafiz Gul Bahadur.
CIA drones struck a house killing 6-8 people. The strike came around 7am, reportedly destroying the house.

Up to five alleged militants were killed in an evening drone attack. The Defence Ministry said two of the dead were senior AQAP figures named Hussein Rubay and Fahad al Harithy. It was not clear if one or two drones took part in the strike, and if one or two cars were hit. Witnesses said while four bodies were pulled from the wreckage of the first vehicle. But said ‘the flames were so intense in the second vehicle that no one could approach to check for any casualties.’

Airstrikes have targeted the only town in Abyan province ‘where jihadists still have a strong presence.’ US officials have confirmed American strike jets are flying missions over Yemen from nearby Djibouti.
In an evening strike, CIA drones struck a house killing at least 17. This was the first strike since Pakistan re-opened its borders to Nato convoys after a seven month diplomatic stand-off.
11-14 were killed when up to 8 missile hit a compound alleged to belong to militant comander Sadiq Noor, ally of Hafiz Gul Bahadur.

4-7 alleged militants died when CIA drones fired 6 missiles at a house. 1 or 2 vehicles exploded. The attack took place hours after Pakistan ambassador to Washington again called for a halt to drone strikes.

Up to five were killed and two more injured while traveling through east Yemen. A possible US drone targeted the men in an evening strike. ‘A drone fired two missiles at an all-terrain vehicle…killing its five occupants,’ according to a local official. The bodies ‘were found completely burnt with the completely destroyed car’.
Suspected US drones targeted two vehicles, killing seven in an evening strike.
Up to three people were killed and two injured in an evening air strike.
At least 5 people killed as tribesmen gathered for Eid, declared early in Waziristan. One named militant was killed, and his wife. A house and car were hit in the attack.
Two vehicles were hit in an early morning strike, killing at least 4. The vehicles were reportedly traveling from Miranshah.
A further 2-3 people were killed when CIA drones returned, reportedly targeting the wreckage of the vehicles destroyed in the day's earlier strike (Ob286).
Badruddin Haqqani, son of the Haqqani leader and the network's senior military commander, may have been killed when 5-25 people died in a 7pm strike.
13-18 people were killed and 14 injured in a coordinated series of strikes that hit villages in the Shawal valley around noon. The strikes came 'minutes apart'.
In a second strike of the day, CIA drones reportedly fired two missiles on a wall compound.
In the third coordinated strike at least three people were killed.
After twenty days without a reported strike, a suspected drone killed at least two people in vehicle driving from Hadramout to Mareb province. A second car reportedly escaped unscathed.

As many as seven people were reportedly killed as they travelled through the village of al Qatn. Up to four missiles were fired at the village causing extensive damage to homes and terrifying the local residents sufficiently for some to be rushed to hospital with shock. At least two civilians were killed in the strike and testimony from their relatives formed part of a submission to an April 2013 Senate subcommittee hearing on the constitutional and counterterrorism implications of targeted killings.

Eight people were killed as they drove through Hadramout province, reportedly local commanders of the Yemen-based al Qaeda offshoot. One report said the men were traveling in an armoured car between Qatan and Khashgha when they were struck at 7.30am. Six bodies were taken to Seiyun hospital while two extremely burnt corpses were left at the scene.
Attacks at 9am on a housing compound and a vehicle reportedly killed 4-6 people.

US drones or jets killed 12 civilians in a botched attack on an alleged senior militant. Eleven died immediately and one subsequently of his injuries. The fourth airstrike in six days, the casualties including women and three children according to local sheikh Ahmed Ali and other locals said a 10-year-old girl and her 40-year-old mother were killed. Both were corroborated by a report compiled by three human rights groups, submitted to a US Senate subcommittee hearing in April 2013. ’The bodies were charred like coal. I could not recognize the faces,’ said Ahmed al Sabooli the dead girl’s 22-year-old brother.

Up to six people were killed and three injured when a US drone reportedly fired eight missiles a house in Hadrhamout. As many as four of the dead were reportedly civilians, three foreigners and one Yemeni.

The Yemen Observer was the sole source to report that US drones killed four people including the brother of an al-Qaeda leader the US had attempted to kill days earlier. Abdulraoof Ahmad Nasser al Thahab was supposedly driving his car in the Qaifa area of Radaa when a drone attacked him.

Seven people including AQAP’s second-in-command Said al Shehri (aka al Shihri) were reportedly killed in a strike on a car and house in Hadrhamout, eastern Yemen, according to US and Yemeni officials. The following month, a recording purporting to be al Shehri emerged, in which he claimed the false rumours of his death were ‘to cover up the killing of innocent Muslim civilians’.
An airstrike killed at least two people in Abyan province.

A car was destroyed when to missiles and three to four militants, possibly linked to Hafiz Gul Bahdur, were killed. This was the first strike in 20 days, and the first after protests over a blasphemous video left up to 17 dead.
At least 5 were killed, inlcuding senior al Qaeda member Abu Kasha al Iraqi, when two missiles destroyed a compound at around 9pm.00
properties.target: Abu Kasha al Iraqi, Saleh al Turki

properties.bij_summary_short: A US drone strike reportedy targeted either a car or motorbike near Mir Ali in North Waziristan, killing 2-4 alleged militants.

A suspected drone strike targeted suspected al Qaeda or Ansar al Sharia militants in the mountainous desert region of al-Saeed in Shabwa province in the late morning, killing at least three and injuring several others. Local media reported five missiles being fired in a multiple strike.
A pre-dawn attack destroyed a compound belonging to Maulvi Abdullah, described as a local cleric, killing five alleged militants and injuring three more, according to reports.
Four missiles were reportedly fired at a madrassa belonging to Maulvi Shakirullah, killing 16-26 and wounding many more.

In a dawn attack, a series of missiles were fired at a targets on the outskirts of Jaar, apparently targeting al Qaeda militants on the verge of launching a suicide attack on military targets. Reuters reported three separate strikes targeted a farmhouse, although ANI/Xinhua claimed the strikes hit two separate gatherings of alleged al Qaeda militants and AP quoted locals saying they had seen two cars ablaze.

An evening strike on a car killed ‘at least four’ alleged al Qaeda members in Maarib province, several miles outside Maarib city, sources reported. Local al Qaeda commander Sanad Ouraidan al Aqili (aka Sanad Abdulla al Aqili) was reported to be among the dead. ‘Aqili’s three companions, whose bodies were blown to pieces, have not been identified yet,’ a local policeman told AFP.
A grandmother was killed when a drone hit a house and car. Several of her grandchildren were injured.
At least three people were killed in a suspected drone strike in northern Yemen. Local al Qaeda commander Omar Saleh al-Tais (aka Attais) was initially reported killed.
As many as three people were killed in a suspected US drone strike. Their vehicle was destroyed less than 24 hours after President Obama was reelected for a second term.
A few hours after Taliban commander Maulvi Nazir was injured in a suicide bombing, 1-4 people were killed in a drone strike.
The second strike on the Shin Warsak area in three days reportedly killed Abdul Rehman al-Zaman Yemeni, described as 'a mid-level al Qaeda commander, equivalent to a colonel'.

4-11 were killed, reportedly including senior al Qaeda commander Sheikh Khalid Bin Abdul Rehman al Hussainan, in the first strike in North Waziristan for 43 days. The Prime Minster Pervez Ashraf complained to US ambassador Olson the same day.
3-4 were killed, including an alleged militant commander Mohammad Ahmed Almansoor. A compound and a car were destroyed in the strike.
At least three alleged militants were reported killed in a strike on a house near Mir Ali.
At least two men were killed in a suspected US drone strike in the southern Bayda province. It was the first strike in Yemen for 47 days and local media reported it hit a car.
Up to five more alleged militants were killed in the second suspected US drone strike of the day.
Missiles fired at a moving motorcycle killed two alleged al Qaeda militants near the town of Shehr, the site of a strike four days earlier.
4-5 people were killed in a strike in the Shawal Valley area on the border of North and South Waziristan.

Missiles hit a Land Cruiser travelling on the outskirts of al-Manaseh village, near Radda, in the fourth strike in a week. At least three alleged al Qaeda members died, including Saleh Mohammed al Ameri, described by unnamed local officials as a senior al Qaeda operative. ‘Their bodies were charred and the car was completely obliterated,’ a tribesman told Reuters. ‘Their bodies were not recognisable, but the government says they’re from al Qaeda.'

In February AFP reported Adel al Abab (aka Adil al Abab, Abu al Zubair) was killed in the second of a pair of strikes in a mountainous region in the eastern Shabwah province. An al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula (AQAP) source told the agency: 'A drone strike had targetted Sheikh Adel al-Abab's vehicle but he escaped and fled to a mountainous region where a raid by another drone killed him immediately.'
In one of their most significant strikes in recent years, CIA drones killed Maulvi Nazir, the powerful leader of the so-called 'good Taliban'.
A strike on a vehicle near Mir Ali, North Waziristan, reportedly killed 3-6 people.

At least three people were killed in a reported drone strike on a vehicle in a ‘mountainous area’ near Radaa. The following day Reuters reported that local tribesmen demonstrated in Radaa against US drone strikes. One told the news agency that ‘seven innocent civilians’ had been killed in recent strikes.
Alleged TTP commander Wali Muhammad Mehsud - reportedly responsible for training suicide bombers - among the dead after as many as five CIA drones bombarded Babar Ghar.
Alleged al Qaeda deputy commander of militant training in Pakistan and Afghanistan killed in the first of twin strikes near Mir Ali
At least 2 killed in second strike, 15 minutes after the first near Mir Ali.
At least three killed in a strike on a motorcycle and house or compound.
The first of a barrage of strikes to hit central Yemen missed its target. Xinhua reported the strike missed a vehicle in an orchard in the al Masil area of Wadi Abeeda.

Several sources, Reuters among them, reported a drone destroyed the vehicle it missed in the first strike. However AFP reported the four occupants had escaped on foot after their narrow escape earlier in the evening. Associated Press, Al Jazeera and Yemen Post identified up to six possible civilian casualties over the course of the day.

At least two were killed in the last strike of the night, although a military vehicle stolen from the Yemen army and carrying six was reportedly destroyed. AFP initially reported that the strike killed four people from the ‘al Haytak clan, part of the Abida tribe’ without specifying if they were also al Qaeda militants. However the agency subsequently reported five alleged al Qaeda militants perished in the strike, including Hamad Hassan Ghreib (aka Amhed Bin Hassan Ali Gahreib).

A fourth strike was reported by the Yemen Observer. Ali al Ghulaisi, spokesman for Marib’s governor, said three alleged militants were killed when a car was destroyed in a desert area of Marib near the border with Jawf province.

At least two men were killed while driving on the Sanaa-Marib highway. Witnesses told Reuters a US drone targeted the vehicle northeast of the capital. Security officials said three people were injured in the strike.
An evening strike reportedly targeted vehicles at an alleged militant training ground, killing at least three and injuring ‘several‘.
A Toyota Hilux was reportedly ‘totally destroyed‘ and the bodies burnt beyond recognition. Casualty reports have varied but a clear picture of the strike emerged in the months after the attack.

A second possible drone strike of the day killed two or four people according to conflicting media reports. The Los Angeles Times reported the strike hit two motorcycles – its intended target – and killing the alleged militants. However anonymous sources gave a contradictory account to Xinhua. They said the strike missed the bikes, hitting a house belonging to Abdu Mohammed al-Jarrah. Two of his children were reportedly killed and three more family members injured.
CIA drones destroyed a house and killed at least 3. Between two and six missiles reportedly hit a building, which caught fire.
CIA drones destroyed a house, killing at least 6, in an area reportedly dominated by the TTP.
Drones kill at least one alleged militant, reportedly on horseback in North Waziristan. The horse died with its rider.
Either a house or vehicle was destroyed, killing at least three alleged militants.
At least four killed in first strike for 24 days. The dead were badly burnt and went unidentified after the third consecutive strike on Datta Khel set a house on fire.
CIA drones destroyed a house in South Waziristan, killing at least four, the day after the ICRC's president criticised the US' drone campaign in Pakistan.

Five alleged al Qaeda militants were killed in the first US drone strike in almost three months. Journalist and activist Farea al Muslimi, a native of Wessab, contested the depiction of al Radami as an al Qaeda commander, although he also reported the view that al Rademi could easily have been arrested. Al Muslimi posted updates to Twitter from Sanaa as information came to him from friends and family in Wessab. And he said most people he spoke to said al Radami was not a part of AQAP. Al Muslimi: "In an area like Wessab, there is nothing easier than capturing a man like al-Radmi. Two police officers would have been more than capable of arresting him."

A dawn strike on a house in Marib province reportedly killed two alleged al Qaeda militants and wounded up to three others. Local media reported a Saudi and an Egyptian were killed while a woman and child were injured.

US drones reportedly destroyed a truck filled with explosives, killed at least four people. The dead were allegedly militants although a ‘local dignitary‘ told AFP he could not say whether the four ‘were Islamist militants’.
The second strike in three days killed two men in central Yemen. Two alleged al Qaeda members were killed ‘as they left a farm on a motorbike’ according to Yemen’s defence ministry website.

The Pakistan Taliban’s second in command Wali ur Rehman was reportedly killed in the first CIA strike in Pakistan for 42 days. At least three other people were killed in the attack in the Miranshah area of North Waziristan.

Two vehicles carrying alleged AQAP militants were destroyed in either two separate strikes or single strike by a pair of aircraft. At least seven people were killed in the attack. Anonymous and named Yemen officials have said US drones carried out the strike.

A night-time strike reportedly killed seven alleged militants and wounded others on the border of North and South Waziristan, Pakistani intelligence officials said. 'The US drone fired two missiles targeting a militant compound and killing at least seven militants,' an unnamed senior intelligence official told AFP.

Multiple missiles struck a vehicle in the northern province of al Jawf, killing between two and six alleged militants. A local reporter tweeted that Huraydan had died alongside two relatives, including his 10-year-old brother.

At least 16 people were killed when CIA drones hit a house and a vehicle in or around the Miranshah bazaar. Casualty figures were low in initial reports but rose as the day wore on. By around 11am local time Reuters and AFP were reporting 17 killed in the strike.
A drone strike killed two alleged militants riding on a motorcycle and damaged nearby buildings in the village of Mosaki, near Mir Ali.
